intro: Erysimum rectum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved wallflower, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, featuring upright stems and bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has linear, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of hair. Its flowers are arranged in racemes and are known for their showy appearance, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. Erysimum rectum prefers well-drained soil and full sun, thriving in rocky or gravelly habitats.
